Entries.NPC.cs.3956: Go find another to gaze longingly at, I am busy.$7
Entries.NPC.cs.3957: Is this your idea of a joke?$6
Entries.NPC.cs.3958: I would almost be flattered...#$b#If I found your affection worth a thing.$3
Entries.NPC.cs.3959: Your presence is taxing enough already.#$b#Take your romantic overtures to an interested party.$6
Entries.NPC.cs.3961: Yes, hilarious.$7#$b#Now what is it you actually want?
Entries.NPC.cs.3962: Ah, I had thought you might be interested...$3#$b#I suppose I have time for such a dalliance.$3#$b#Very well; I accept. I do rather enjoy your company.$3#$b#You're welcome to grace me with it this evening, if you like.$4
Entries.NPC.cs.3963: Ah, I had thought you might be interested...$3#$b#I suppose I have time for such a dalliance.$3#$b#Very well; I accept. I do rather enjoy your company.$3#$b#You're welcome to grace me with it this evening, if you like.$4
Entries.NPC.cs.3965: Perhaps resolve your standing engagements before proposing all willy-nilly.
Entries.NPC.cs.3966: Perhaps resolve your standing engagements before proposing all willy-nilly.
Entries.NPC.cs.3967: I do not have time to deal with the ire of a jealous spouse, thank you.
Entries.NPC.cs.3968: I've little interest in being a part of your relationship.$6
Entries.NPC.cs.3970: Is this your idea of a joke?$6
Entries.NPC.cs.3971: Do you think me waiting to leap into the arms of whomever will have me?$6
Entries.NPC.cs.3972: That is rather more than either of us agreed to, no?$1
Entries.NPC.cs.3973: I have no such interest in you, thank you.$6
Entries.NPC.cs.3974: What must I do to make my refusal clear?$6
Entries.NPC.cs.3975: If you are under the impression your persistence is endearing, it is not.#$b#Cease this pestering immediately.$6
Entries.NPC.cs.3980: This is-!$11#$b#After that embarrassing display I put you through, you'd still seek a life with me?$0#$b#Really, you are ridiculous.$9#$b#If you truly wish for it, then I would be glad for all the time you'd deign to spend with me.$0#$b#That is a 'yes', if you must hear it said. Nothing would make me happier.$1
Entries.NPC.cs.3985: I heard you've been showering {0} with gifts?
Entries.NPC.cs.4001: Here. A stardrop; a rare fruit said to boost vitality.$9#$b#I thought it might prove useful, with all you do.$1
Entries.NPC.cs.4274: Is it my nameday already? I confess I hardly bother to keep track, after so many.#$b#...My thanks for the gift, regardless.$1
Entries.NPC.cs.4275: Is it my nameday already? I confess I hardly bother to keep track, after so many.#$b#...My thanks for the gift, regardless.$1
Entries.NPC.cs.4276: It will do as a gift, I suppose.#$b#Good work, farmer.$1
Entries.NPC.cs.4277: It will do as a gift, I suppose.
Entries.NPC.cs.4278: Either you are singularly terrible at getting gifts, or rather good at spiting me.$6
Entries.NPC.cs.4279: Either you are singularly terrible at getting gifts, or rather good at spiting me.$6
Entries.NPC.cs.4280: ...#$b#Am I intended to be grateful for this?$6
Entries.NPC.cs.4281: ...#$b#Am I intended to be grateful for this?$6
Entries.NPC.cs.4293: Aim that in my direction again and you will be made to regret it.$6
Entries.NPC.cs.4294: Do you have a death wish, farmer?
Entries.NPC.cs.4406: I've decided I will do nothing today but sleep.$0#$e#I will not be taking input on the matter.$6
Entries.NPC.cs.4421: Perhaps I should take some time away...
Entries.NPC.cs.4422: Was I mistaken, letting you sweep me off my feet?$9
Entries.NPC.cs.4423: Leave me be. I am fine.$7
Entries.NPC.cs.4424: Something is not right in my measurements, but I cannot discern what! How irritating...$6
Entries.NPC.cs.4425: Leave me to my work; I am busy.
Entries.NPC.cs.4426: If you want me to attend to your every need, you will have to catch me in a more doting mood.
Entries.NPC.cs.4431: At times I find myself with regrets.$9
Entries.NPC.cs.4432: Truly, the exhaustion of maintaining a home is endless.#$e$I can simply use magick, but that does not mean it isn't draining.$8
Entries.NPC.cs.4433: Do you truly have nothing better to do than hover over me?
Entries.NPC.cs.4439: Just what will life look like with the new child...$9
Entries.NPC.cs.4440: I'm well familiar with the glacial pace of bureaucracy, but the adoption request had best be approved soon.$8
Entries.NPC.cs.4441: I've filed our adoption papers with the agency.#$b#I cannot imagine we would be refused, but the waiting has me restless all the same.$8
Entries.NPC.cs.4447: We'll have a child soon... I can scarce believe it.$9
Entries.NPC.cs.4448: Your soul...$11#$b#...I see another.$11#$b#To think you're with child, {0} ...wonderful.$1
Entries.NPC.cs.4449: The joys of having a child: getting to wake up obscenely early.$0#$b#Perhaps I'll roll back into bed and leave the honor to you.$6
Entries.NPC.cs.4452: Ugh, I have too much work to attend to.$7#$b#Please do not disturb me, for a time.
Entries.NPC.cs.4455: I thought to make you breakfast, but you can forget that.$10
Entries.NPC.cs.4462: It looked like you had much on your plate today, so I've taken the liberty of watering your crops.#$b#You're welcome.$1
Entries.NPC.cs.4463: I've filled {0}'s water bowl as well.
Entries.NPC.cs.4470: I'd thought to water the crops as a gift, only to find there was nothing for me to do.$h#$b#Excellent work running the farm so smoothly, @.$h
Entries.NPC.cs.4474: I've already seen to feeding the many beasts you keep around. The task of gathering all they produce I leave to you, however.#$e#I will not walk around smelling like a barn, thank you.$6
Entries.NPC.cs.4481: The fences were beginning to deteriorate. A bit of magick restored them to their proper state.#$e#Perhaps a word of thanks is in order for my efforts?
Entries.NPC.cs.4488: A new design occurred to me, and I thought to add it to our home.
Entries.NPC.cs.4489: I thought the room could use a more refined touch.
Entries.NPC.cs.4490: I had an idea for the decor, but you've left me nowhere to work with!$10
Entries.NPC.cs.4496: I refreshed the design for the walls for a change of pace.
Entries.NPC.cs.4497: The flooring needed an update to better suit the decor. You're welcome for my immaculate taste.
Entries.NPC.cs.4498: ...*sigh*$9.#$b#How wonderful life used to be...and how tiring it has become.
Entries.NPC.cs.4499: What reason is there to leave the comfort of bed? Certainly none are apparent to me.$6
Entries.NPC.cs.4500: Must you leave your belongings scattered haphazardly? I can barely move without knocking into something!$8
Entries.SummitEvent_Intro_Spouse: There you are, @. Care to join me?
Entries.SummitEvent_Intro2_Spouse: I never tire of the view from up here... It really is something special, isn't it?$h
Entries.SummitEvent_Intro2_Spouse_Gruff: I never tire of the view from up here... It really is something special, isn't it?$h
Entries.SummitEvent_Dialogue1_Spouse: It has been %year years, but on occasion I still am taken by surprise, thinking about our life together.$9"/pause 1000/speak spouse "We've been through quite a lot, haven't we?
Entries.SummitEvent_Dialogue2_Spouse: ...And yet we made it this far.$h
Entries.ExtraDialogue_Mines_PlayerKilled_Spouse_: I searched for you after you did not come home, only to find you within an inch of your life!$5#b# ...Be careful, @. I cannot bear to lose you.$2
I searched for you after you did not come home, only to find you within an inch of your life!$5#b# ...Be careful, @. I cannot bear to lose you.$2
Entries.ExtraDialogue_NewChild_SecondChild1: I am often beside myself, thinking of how our family has grown.$h#$b#What a gift it is, to be part of it.$h
Entries.ExtraDialogue_NewChild_SecondChild2: That our family should grow yet again... is a joy beyond words.
Entries.ExtraDialogue_NewChild_Adoption: It fills me with joy, welcoming little {0} into our life.$h#$e#And I must admit, the process was easier than expected. You would not believe the amount of paperwork this would have required in Amaurot.
Entries.ExtraDialogue_NewChild_FirstChild: It fills me with joy, welcoming little {0} into our life.$h
Entries.ExtraDialogue_Spouse_KitchenBlocked: That I *can* teleport into the kitchen does not mean I would like to be forced to do so.$6
Entries.ExtraDialogue_Spouse_MonstersInHouse: I will not tolerate having an unruly beast in the house, @.$6
Entries.ExtraDialogue_SummitEvent_Intro_Spouse: There you are, @. Care to join me?
Entries.ExtraDialogue_SummitEvent_Intro2_Spouse: I never tire of the view from up here... It really is something special, isn't it?$h
Entries.ExtraDialogue_SummitEvent_Intro2_Spouse_: I never tire of the view from up here... It really is something special, isn't it?$h
Entries.ExtraDialogue_SummitEvent_Dialogue1_Spou: It has been %year years, but on occasion I still am taken by surprise, thinking about our life together.$9"/pause 1000/speak spouse "We've been through quite a lot, haven't we?
Entries.ExtraDialogue_SummitEvent_Dialogue2_Spou: ...And yet we made it this far.$h
Entries.ExtraDialogue_Town_DumpsterDiveComment_A: Are you seriously digging through the garbage!? Disgusting.$6
Entries.ExtraDialogue_PurchasedItem_1_QualityHig: I thought to pick up {1} {2} while passing through town; I so rarely come across it.#$b#Cooking it filled the kitchen with a {3} aroma... I suspect this was your work, farmer?$1
Entries.ExtraDialogue_PurchasedItem_1_QualityLow: I thought to pick up {1} {2} while passing through town; I so rarely come across it.#$b#Only to be assaulted by a {3} stench. I didn't know the shopkeep had taken to stocking his shelves with garbage.$6
Entries.ExtraDialogue_PurchasedItem_2_QualityHig: I purchased {1} {2} the other day... you were growing them, correct?#$b#Good work, farmer.$u
Entries.ExtraDialogue_PurchasedItem_2_QualityLow: I purchased {1} {2} the other day... you were growing them, correct?#$b#I suggest you find another line of work, one you have a modicum of talent for.$6
Entries.ExtraDialogue_PurchasedItem_3_QualityLow: I went shopping the other day and picked up {1} {2} on sale for a mere {3}g.#$e# How {4} it was; little wonder the price was so low.$6#$b#And even that was far more than the {5} was worth.$10
Entries.ExtraDialogue_PurchasedItem_3_QualityHig: I went shopping the other day and picked up {1} {2} on sale for a mere {3}g.#$e# Not bad at all, for the price. Quite {4}.$1
Entries.ExtraDialogue_PurchasedItem_4: The General Store had {1} {2} you'd brought in on display; I picked some up to try tonight.#$e#I hope it will be worth the trouble.$8
Entries.ExtraDialogue_PurchasedItem_5_VegetableO: I bought {2} you'd sold to the shop the other day.#$b#The owner boasted how he 'grew the thing in his own backyard'. He does not want for gall, I'll grant him that.$1
Entries.ExtraDialogue_PurchasedItem_5_Cooking: I bought {2} from the shop the other day. #$b#He said he cooked it himself, as if the despondent cries of his family cannot be overheard when he is in charge of meals.$u
Entries.ExtraDialogue_PurchasedItem_5_Foraged: I saw {2} for sale in the General Store the other day.#$e#The shopkeep actually claimed to have found it himself while exploring!$u#$e#His wife is far more accomplished at than he at finding the 'fruits of the woods', I should think.$u
